column5: Agree, Buster's is some GREAT bbq!!!
Stopped at the bakery a couple of years ago and they had some great breads...but can't understand why they aren't open on Saturday when there is a lot of traffic leaving and arriving.
They were open several years ago early morning on Saturday,and we stopped and got something or other, don't remember what it was. At the time, they didn't have a very large selection. Bill
Read a few older post here on the subject, but am wondering if there still is any place to eat dinner and/or breakfast in town.Will be heading up that way at the end of August.ThanksJeff in Iowa

Lunch / dinner at Buster's BBQ in the fort or at the food truck at Bobby's Corner......I think both open around 11:00. Quakers Diner is sometimes open and does breakfast but their hours seem variable. The bakery has good coffee and does some lunch items but isn't open on the weekend.
V-GordThanks, looking forward to a relaxing meal and cold beverage after our long drive.Jeff

Morning breakfast at the end of September is hard to come by, in the past we have been settling for pre-made sandwiches or junk food convenience store style. I guess trying to keep a steady business cafe open all year is just mighty tough in that area. Bill
Is Buster's full-service again. I'd drive to VB just to eat there....well, fishing would need to be involved as I think about it.
Here is a link to Busters Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/bustersblueberrybbq/

We come in to Vermilion Bay from Dryden. We stop at the truckstop on the west side of Dryden. Serve great breakfasts and except U.S. currency. They open at 7 AM. When paying in U.S. money remember the change will always be in Canadian.

This reminded me of my buddy....when you pay you get back canadian money....we were at the beer store...he paid with american money and started to complain when he got canadian back....i looked at him and said...well, your in Canada ya dip@@@@!!!! What did you expect...stop being the dumba## american who expects american money back!!! They guy working looked at me a laughed and said...we get that all the time. I apologized for him.
A few years back I was on a safari in Kenya. An American woman complained the food was different than back home. Makes u wanna crawl into a hole and say you are from Canada.Big McWaterBuffalo please.
Maybe Gord will cook you a nice breakfast
